channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Keys to the City of New York Are Made in New Jersey
item.description: Mayor Eric Adams has handed out dozens of ceremonial golden keys during his single term. Since 2023, they have come from across the Hudson River.

item.title: Even as Trump Targets Boats in Strikes, Coast Guard Continues Anti-Drug Operations
item.description: Cutters are still stopping smugglers and seizing drugs, but the prosecutions of go-fast boat crews are dwindling in a realignment of federal resources...

item.title: Zohran Mamdani to get sworn in twice—once underground at abandoned Subway station and once before freezing block party
item.description: New York Attorney General Letitia James, a political ally and notable foe of President Donald Trump, will administer the oath of office.

item.title: Warren Buffett’s career advice to young professionals is to ‘hang out with people better than you’
item.description: “If this gives you a little temporary unpopularity with your peer group, the hell with 'em,” Buffett’s former business partner Charlie Munger added.

item.title: Will the A.I. Boom Continue to Drive Up Stocks in 2026?
item.description: The boom in artificial intelligence was the biggest driver of gains in the stock market. That could pose a risk in 2026.

item.title: Strange political bedfellows not that strange in the season of the new nihilism
item.description: The worry is that a national Depression might catch up to us, but the real problem lies with the national depression.

item.title: Mamdani Will Be First N.Y.C. Mayor to Use the Quran at His Swearing-In
item.description: Zohran Mamdani, New York City’s first Muslim mayor, will use two family Qurans and one that belonged to the writer Arturo Schomburg at his two swearin...

item.title: Tatiana Schlossberg Was a Kennedy, and a Rookie Reporter
item.description: Tatiana Schlossberg, who died on Tuesday, was the granddaughter of John F. Kennedy. But as a journalist, her first editor remembers, she insisted on p...

item.title: Trump Mobile says its first-ever smartphone is delayed, and the government shutdown is to blame
item.description: Trump Mobile "had to pause everything on the FCC side of things" during the shutdown, which is why the golden $499 T1 smartphone won't launch this yea...

item.title: Bangladeshis Pay Last Respects to Former Leader in Tense Capital
item.description: Huge crowds turned out to say goodbye to Khaleda Zia, the country’s first female prime minister, amid a huge army presence following recent political ...

item.title: Mali and Burkina Faso Impose Travel Bans on Americans
item.description: The West African countries said they made the decisions in retaliation against the Trump administration’s move to block their citizens from entering t...

item.title: New Year’s 2026 Celebrations Around the World: Photos and Videos
item.description: See how people across the globe celebrated.

item.title: Brigitte Bardot’s Legacy of Racist Rhetoric
item.description: The actress, who died this week at 91, was an icon of 1960s cinema. She was also a hero to the French far right.

item.title: Ahead of New Year, Sydney Holds Vigil for Bondi Beach Attack Victims
item.description: Thousands gathered around the harbor to lift candles and phone lights during a minute of silence in solidarity with the Jewish community that was targ...

item.title: Seafood thieves snatch $400,000 of lobster, plus oysters and crabs, in round of New England robberies
item.description: Imagine the buffet. Forty-thousand oysters, lobster worth $400,000 and a cache of crabmeat all were stolen in separate incidents within weeks of each ...
